alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 9:58PM CST until March 07 at 5:32PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Meramec River near Sullivan. Meramec River near Steelville. Meramec River near Eureka. Meramec River at Pacific. Meramec River at Valley Park. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meramec River near Sullivan. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, A small bridge in the back of Meramec State Park park is flooded, cutting the park in two. If the river continues to rise...park officials will evacuate the campgrounds at this point. At 12.0 feet, The main entrance gate at Onondaga Cave State Park begins flooding near this height. This may eventually force the park to use the rear entrance as the primary entrance to the park. At 18.5 feet, Near this height, Missouri Route N will be closed in both directions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CST Friday the stage was 13.2 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The river rose above flood stage Friday afternoon and has continued to rise. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Sun Mon Tue Wed Thu Meramec River Steelville 12.0 11.0 13.4 8.3 5.3 4.0 3.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
